alert.note: Alert for Carroll; City of Galax; Grayson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 10 at 2:53PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Flood Advisory for Eastern Grayson, Western Carroll, and the City of Galax continue until 4 PM EDT this afternoon... ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, Carroll, City of Galax and Grayson. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 245 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Galax. Between 1.0 and 1.5 inch of rain has fallen during the past few hours. The ground is saturated in this area from previous heavy rainfall. Additional rainfall will quickly result in excessive runoff and flooding. - Galax remains vulerable to minor flooding as a result of earlier heavy rainfall and poor drainage. This following streams and drainages could be impacted from the heavy rainfall... Mill Creek, Dixon Branch, Hanks Branch, Little Cranberry Creek, Little River, Chestnut Creek, Crooked Creek, Meadow Creek, East Fork Crooked Creek, Fisher River, Beaver Creek and Glady Fork. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Galax... Fries... Pipers Gap... Baywood... Woodlawn... - For additional information on creeks, streams, rivers, and lake levels in our forecast area please go to our web site located at: http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Precautionary/Preparedness Statements: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
